thread.title: Guestlisted Guitar: Tony Savarino on Eddie Van Halen and tapping | Guestlisted | with Jed Gottlieb
thread.title_full: Guestlisted Guitar: Tony Savarino on Eddie Van Halen and tapping | Guestlisted | with Jed Gottlieb | Boston Herald

author: Jed Gottlieb
title: Guestlisted Guitar: Tony Savarino on Eddie Van Halen and tapping | Guestlisted | with Jed Gottlieb
text:
As a hack guitarist, I spend a lot of time wondering what the hell Eddie Van Halen is doing. To help me understand how simple it is-- Wait, let me back that up. To understand the logic behind Eddie's skills, I had Tony Savarino over to the couch.
Savarino can play any style. And he does on his trilogy of LPs: "Guitaring,” “Guitaresque,” and “Guitararino.” On them the hotshot tears into classic stuff with equal amounts of reverence, pluck and cheek. He lays down Bobby Hebb's “Sunny” with lounge cool (a little Wes Montgomery in there?), carves up the Ventures' arrangement of Tchaikovsky and twists Duke Ellington's “Caravan” into a Van Halen/Yngwie Malmsteen hydra. Savarino is also a first call guy in bands around New England -- he's playing with Ruby Rose Fox and I couldn't be happier (see them at The Delancey in NYC on Friday).
If you dig Savarino, or Eddie, get your rock on with Alex Necochea . If you don't dig, you're nuts. But you can still enjoy the rest of the Guestlisted Guitar collection.
